folder: South Street & Dover Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
South Street, under the Brooklyn Bridge, showing several warehouses that face the East River, and from which the photographer is viewing. These bear No's. 168-70 South Street. They are between Dover and Roosevelt Street's.

October 1927

George L. Balgue, photo

Fires, Accidents and Tragedies: A fire at Pier 10, East River as viewed northward on South Street from the foot of Old Slip. This set of 3 views show the Brooklyn Bridge in their backgrounds.

August 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Fires, accidents and tragedies - [Fire at Pier 10 East River.]

text:
Fires, Accidents and Tragedies: A fire at Pier 10, East River as viewed northward on South Street from the foot of Old Slip. This set of 3 views show the Brooklyn Bridge in their backgrounds.

August 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Fires, accidents and tragedies - [Fire at Pier 10 East River.]

text:
Fires, Accidents and Tragedies: A fire at Pier 10, East River as viewed northward on South Street from the foot of Old Slip. This set of 3 views show the Brooklyn Bridge in their backgrounds.

August 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Fires, accidents and tragedies - [Fire at Pier 10 East River.]

text:
East River, showing (right) pier 10, off South Street, at the foot of Old Slip. This pier was demolished between 1931 and 1934 (see G.W. Bromley maps) to permit the widening of pier 9.

December 10, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Piers 10.

folder: Dover Street & South Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Dover Street, north side, west from South Street. This view also shows South Street, west side, at Dover Street.

May 3, 1932.

P: L: Sperr.

folder: South Street & Dover Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
South Street, north side, east from Dover Street. Overhead is shown the Brooklyn Bridge, with a portion of Pier No. 21, on the right.
August 21, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at an earlier date. May 3, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE EAST AND WEST.

folder: South Street & Dover Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
South Street, north side, east from Dover Street. Overhead is shown the Brooklyn Bridge, with a portion of Pier No. 21, on the right.
August 21, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at an earlier date. May 3, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE EAST AND WEST.

folder: South ferry, Williamsburg bridge. [Manhattan: Dover Street.], NY
text:
(1)
East River, shore and skyline, south from Dover Street, showing piers abutting into the river from the east side of South Street. Also shown is a portion of the skyline of Lower Manhattan and (left) Governor's Island. The vantage point is the Brooklyn Bridge.

June 5, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, another view. The same vantage point as view 1.

June 5, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
An additional view at a later date. Also shown are the S.S. Saramaca docked at pier 20, and the S.S. Gatun, at pier 19. The same vantage point as views 1 & 2.

July 31, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - shore and skyline ; South ferry, Williamsburg bridge. [Manhattan: Dover Street.]
